convert hail.table.Table to R data frame

Source: R/as.data.frame.R
as.data.frame.hail.table.Table.Rd

convert hail.table.Table to R data frame

# S3 method for hail.table.Table
as.data.frame(x, row.names = NULL, optional = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x

instance of "hail.table.Table"

row.names

not used

optional

not used

...

not used

Value

data.frame

Note

only use on small table because collect is used

Examples

hl = hail_init()
#> + '/home/stvjc/.cache/R/basilisk/1.11.3/0/bin/conda' 'create' '--yes' '--prefix' '/home/stvjc/.cache/R/basilisk/1.11.3/BiocHail/0.99.16/bsklenv' 'python=3.8.13' '--quiet' '-c' 'conda-forge'
#> + '/home/stvjc/.cache/R/basilisk/1.11.3/0/bin/conda' 'install' '--yes' '--prefix' '/home/stvjc/.cache/R/basilisk/1.11.3/BiocHail/0.99.16/bsklenv' 'python=3.8.13'
#> + '/home/stvjc/.cache/R/basilisk/1.11.3/0/bin/conda' 'install' '--yes' '--prefix' '/home/stvjc/.cache/R/basilisk/1.11.3/BiocHail/0.99.16/bsklenv' '-c' 'conda-forge' 'python=3.8.13' 'pandas=1.3.5'
annopath <- path_1kg_annotations()
tab <- hl$import_table(annopath, impute=TRUE)$key_by("Sample")
as.data.frame(tab$head(3L))
#>    Sample Population SuperPopulation isFemale PurpleHair CaffeineConsumption
#> 1 HG00096        GBR             EUR    FALSE      FALSE                   4
#> 2 HG00097        GBR             EUR     TRUE       TRUE                   4
#> 3 HG00098        GBR             EUR    FALSE      FALSE                   5
